dt-api.summary: Create a new API instance with the value of a property from the objects in the current result set.
dt-api.description:
When working with objects you may often find that you want an array containing just one property of the source object. This typically involves writing a trivial loop to create that array, although here, that loop is performed in this method, reducing the amount of code required to a trivial function call to get the data required.

		This method makes use of the fact that DataTables API objects are "array like", in that they inherent a lot of the abilities and methods of the Javascript `Array` type.
dt-api.name: pluck()

example.title: Pluck the name property from the data objects for the table rows

parameter.content: Object property name to use from the element in the original result set for the new result set. This will typically be a string with the target property name, but can also be an array index if working with arrays.
parameter.name: property

type.description: Iterate over the result set of an API instance, creating a new API instance from the values retrieved from the original elements.

returns.content: New API instance with the values in the result retrieved from the source object properties defined by the property being plucked.
